Text.val: -- Author: Stephan Huppertz
09.05.2014 SH SCR18558 Extended queue definition (more queues and defintion per day)
03.05.2013 JH SCR18105 Removed external flag
16.11.2010 SH SCR15902 Jobs which are sumitted for the next working day are
scheduled now in the day queues (before the nights queues were used)
24.09.2010 SH SCR15822 Changed the jobqueue handling (job queue is now passed
to GB701 as parameter, instead of changing jobqueues in the MAGIC400.INI)
13.04.2010 SH SCR15431 Replaced hardcoded jobqueue names by logical names
03.09.2007 SH SCR12766 suspend MGSRVN_MAX in case of PI.TYPE = 'A'
07.02.2007 AK SCR12288 when errors Occurs. Tern job to MSGW
04.01.2006 BT SCR9910 added new functionality (submittime and jobq and param)
26.01.04 BT -> SCR5361 starts #GB701 only if queue1 or queue2 = 'Y'
--Last modified 25.04.2002 Leon - If PI.RUNTYPE not 'M' set to 'A'
--Last modified 20.06.2002 Leon - Transaction begin of Start Server Jobs is
changed to 'before record prefix'
-Last Modified 27.06.2002 Leon. In order to send Night Jobs to the special JOBQ
INIPUT function is used for overriding of JOBQ1 and JOBQ2 Parameters.
-- GNRL_DAYPROGRAMSDAY <> CALD_DATE, no row exist in table CALD
-- PI.RUNTYPE = A (automatic) and GNRL_DAYPROGRAMSDATE <> date()
-- No errors :Start Jobs
-- Suspend MGSRVN_MAX if PI.RUNTYPE = A
-- Errors : Turn job to message wait
-- Daily jobs
-- Weekly jobs
-- Monthly jobs (cannot be scheduled for specific date)
-- Starting already today
... skip submit if schedule time is in the past (check with + 5 minutes to be sure)
... all other daily jobs are started at the next working day
@Info: Weekly jobs are always scheduled in the evening of the last working day of a week (normally=Friday)
... schedule date is defined for a specific day within the next 7 days
... determine day of week for next start day
... determine days to be added to calculate the schedule date
(In case DOW() of current date = DOW() of schedule day, the date of next week is calculated, so if BMN000 is running
at a Friday and JOBS_START_DAY = Friday, the job is scheduled for the next Friday)
... from current date until last day of week (7=Saturday) --> Days of current week
... all days of next week
